intro: Acnistus bornmuelleri, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and alternate, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, which bloom in spring. It has a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation, a characteristic shared with other members of the Apocynaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
